Class HuffmanTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.miracosta.cs113.BinaryTree
      • edu.miracosta.cs113.HuffmanTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HuffmanInterface, java.io.Serializable

    public class HuffmanTree
extends BinaryTree
implements HuffmanInterface
    HuffmanTree : class that is used for building Huffman tree and encoding the text.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dyrenkova
    See Also:

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String codedMessage)
      Decodes a message using the generated Huffman tree, where each character in the given message ('1's and '0's) corresponds to traversals through said tree.
      java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String message)
      Outputs the message encoded from the generated Huffman tree.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getEncodingTable()
      returns an ArrayList that represents encoding table

        public HuffmanTree()

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        public java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String codedMessage)
        Decodes a message using the generated Huffman tree, where each character in the given message ('1's and '0's) corresponds to traversals through said tree.
        Specified by:
        decode in interface HuffmanInterface
        Parameters:
        codedMessage - The compressed message based on this Huffman tree's encoding
        Returns:
        The given message in its decoded form

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String message)
        Outputs the message encoded from the generated Huffman tree. pre: the Huffman tree has been built using characters by which the message is only comprised.
        Specified by:
        encode in interface HuffmanInterface
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be decoded
        Returns:
        The given message in its specific Huffman encoding of '1's and '0's

      • getEncodingTable

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getEncodingTable()
        returns an ArrayList that represents encoding table
        Returns:
        ArrayList that represents encoding table (with each first element being the code and every second being a character encoded)
